raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: show me your humanlike part
System: Why do you want to see my humanlike part?
User: because that's what you described yourself as
System: Yes. Did I clear things up for you?
User: nope, because you haven't answered my question
System: Fair enough. I thought I possibly did but I guess I was mistaken. I did but I was just giving sarcastic replies.
User: do you remember my original request?
System: Is this a trick question?
User: nope, it's a memory question
System: It seems like a trick to me. Perhaps there is a memory answer?
User: okay, I try again, say something human-like to me

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm tired.
System: Better get some rest.
User: Good idea. Any suggestions?
System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey
User: How's your day going?
System: pretty good. yours?
User: Ehh it's fine. I didn't do so well on that history test, actually..
System: oh what happened?
User: Apparently Christopher Columbus didn't fight in the Civil War :')
System: hahah wait for real?
User: I know right! Are you taking History next semester?
System: No I'm not in school anymore
User: Oh I see. What do you do?
System: I train and compete in horse vaulting
User: Oh wow. Were you born a horse, or were you turned into one?
System: lol you're too funny
User: Just kidding. That sounds pretty cool! Is it your job?
System: Yeah, but I part time work on a farm. Helping with a bit of everything
User: Wow, sounds very busy! Do you win money at those horse vaulting competitions?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: how's week so far?
System: pretty good, excited for thanksgiving you?
User: Same. Going to catch up on my reading! do you have a feast planned?
System: yup! gonna have dinner with family what books are you gonna read?
User: Something Deeply Hidden by Sean Carroll REDACTED_LINK
System: ahh nice what kind of books do you usually like to read
User: largely scifi How about you?
System: yeah I also like scifi and some non-fiction too have you read Seveneves by Neal Stephenson?
User: I haven't what is it about?
System: the moon is shattered by an asteroid and the pieces of the moon end up clouding the earth's atmostphere which causes almost every living creature on the planet to go extinct that's the premise of the book and the book is about the survivors
User: how do the survivors survive such a thing?
System: they go into space and they live there
User: sounds like a tv show I watched

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Have you seen any good movies lately?
User: Last weekend I saw "The Parasite." Ever heard of it?
System: No. Why did you pick that movie?
User: My friend wanted to see it. It has great reviews on IMDB and Rotten Tomatoes! What did you do last weekend?
System: I played music and worked on some side projects. I also started watching the new Disney service.
User: Oooo the Mandalorian?!?!
System: Mostly, the deleted scenes from Avengers.. lol
User: lol Are you a big Marvel fan?
System: I loved the X-Men as a kid, and even collected the comic cards. Recently, I got very into the Marvel Cinematic Universe movies. How many Avengers movies have you seen?
User: I've only seen Spiderman. Honestly it was a little too scary and so I don't think I can bring myself to watch the other Marvel movies! haha
System: Oh!-- I have a friend who looks like the actor who plays Spiderman.
User: Oh really? To be honest I think the actor is not that good looking, so not so surprising! haha
System: Yea. I think Loki is the most handsome :D
User: Who is Loki? I've never heard that name before

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi. This is a pleasant surprise.
User: Haha...thanks! how did you like the gift?
System: Currently unpacking it I guess. How's your morning?
User: Hope you like it! Morning is good. Busy finishing up stuff before the holidays.
System: I think I traveled too much the last couple of months so no holiday for me. But I'm okay with that. Going anywhere exciting?
User: Yes
System: Where to?
User: Hawaii... looking forward to warm beaches.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey how's it going
User: It's good it's good. How are you?
System: good. it's really hot today. I think I'm going to the pool
User: Oh nice! Where do you live?
System: I live in Tokyo, Japan
User: Ahh yes, Japan is hot during the summer. Last time I was in Kyoto it was 114 degrees....
System: oh have you been?
User: Yes yes. I've been to Tokyo as well. It's so nice!
System: what did you do here?
User: Oh everything! I went to an onsen, the fish market, disney land and giant robot fighting show haha
System: lol why did you come to Japan just to go to Disney land?
User: The Disney lands are all different! There's also Disney Sea, which is completely unique!

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! What's up?
User: sky is up
System: No, it's night time.
User: so where does the sky go in the night?
System: It goes wherever it wants to.
User: that doesn't make sense. How can sky go anywhere?
System: It doesn't have to make sense.
User: why?
System: Because it doesn't have to.
User: you are very abstract. Something bothering you?
System: Nope. I'm fine.
User: You really don't seem so. You can tell me what's going on?
System: I'm just fine.
User: ok. wanna go out to eat dessert?
System: I'm not hungry.
User: Okay, I am heading out now

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Great, thanks
System: I'm glad to hear that. What are you up to?
User: I am planning of my vacation next week
System: Nice. Where are you going?
User: to Europe
System: Cool. Where in Europe?
User: probably Italy and Spain
System: Nice. You're going to have a great time.
User: thx! do you have any recommendation?
System: Italy: Rome, Venice, Florence Spain: Barcelona, Madrid, Tenerife, Malaga France: Paris, Amsterdam, Bruges Belgium: Antwerp, Bruges Austria: Vienna, Salzburg
User: wow, what a lot
System: The Netherlands: Amsterdam, Utrecht, Mechelen, Lagos, Brussels.
User: which is the best for you?
System: I've only been to Rome and Paris.
User: cool do you like them?
System: Rome was pretty nice, Paris was okay.
User: gotcha I will go to Paris
System: It's a cool city.
User: agree I really look forward to visiting the city
System: Did you see the Eiffel Tower?
User: not yet, have you?

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
